reviewText: It only got one star because I couldn't give it a zero, This movie is unbelievable bad. No one in the theatre laughed at all, not ever once. (I could hear Crickets cherping it was so quiet.)How they roped Billy Crystal  into this mess is beyond me. Please... Trust me, don't see this movie.  You'll be begging for that 90 minutes of your life back.

reviewText: The relationship between self-centered agent Billy Crystal and real-life NBA star Gheorghe Muresan is the main reason to watch this otherwise sentimental, few laughs comedy.  Crystal is his usual competent self in a role obviously written with him in mind.  In his film debut, Muresan brings an affable presence in his role as a 7 1/2 ft. giant Crystal stumbles on while visiting his current client in Romania.  The young actor (Rider Strong) fires Crystal and Crystal decides to put the rather naive giant into the same movie.  Muresan agrees only to find the love his youth who now lives in Galloop, USA.  (Gallup, New Mexico).  A subplot involves Crystal's failed marriage with Kathleen Quinlan (who doesn't get to do a whole lot, but is always watchable).  Martial arts star Steven Segal plays himself, and Joanna Pacula appears as the rather disappointing love of Muresan's life.  Hokey and often trite, MY GIANT is fun to watch because of its two stars.

reviewText: This is a movie I would reccommend to everyone. But get a box of kleenex ready because the ending is very sad. It is a great lighthearted comedy. This was a movie that I have been wanting in my collection for quite a while but could never find it to buy in any local stores in my area. Found i right here on Amazon.com and I orderd the DVD and got it in the mail today. I bought it along with "White Squall" and I still haven't watched both DVD's yet but as far as I know, it came undamaged. Thank you alot Amazon.com!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You are Totally AWSOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Peter Smith!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If you have enjoyed this movie, I would also recommend "Jack" starring Robin Williams.

reviewText: Georghe Murasan was a 7'7" RoumanianBasketball Centre who Comedian (sup-posedly) Billy Crystal tabbed to c0-star with him in this surprisinglyunfunny Comedy about a Talent(less)Talent agent, Sammy Kamin, who goesto Eastern Europe to find 'the nextbig thing', and he literally does!Murasan, who injured his ankle sobadly in this film just jumpingacross a stream in what became anouttake scene, that he only cameback and played one more NBA game(0-1 shooting for New Jersey), isa tame, gentle giant in a Monestarythat Pulls Kamin out of his upside-down in a stream rental car andsaves the losers life. I reallyhate to put Crystal, who likemyself is a rabid L.A. Clippersfan, but this movie is just notvery good. The ending, where thesmarmy Kamin gets his come-uppenseis solid but along the way we en-counter a wrestling scene (NATU-RALLY!) AND a vulgar Rabbi, played by ex-McHale's Navy vet CarlBallantine, who eats pork! Ifthis your idea of humour, you mightlike it but I didn't!
summary: The Movie that ended both of Georghe Murasan's careers!

reviewText: Billy Crystal at his best in this quirky movie.  A real "mutt and jeff" contrast between the two actors but it really works.  At times I found myself laughing and at other times in tears.  This movie takes your emotions on a roller coaster ride and I would highly recommend this movie to anyone who likes a good comedy/drama mix.

reviewText: This movie was about a giant who meets an agent(Billy Crystal). They travel to United States and appear in a couple of movies. This movie shows the relationship of the two people, and the relationship improves throughout the movie. If this movie didn't have Billy Crystal it would of been a failure, but since it did it was funny and enjoyable.

reviewText: I think this movie suffered from a misleading ad campaign which made it  look like a slapstick comedy. It's not.It's adult comedy-drama, and a  pretty good one. Crystal, the ultimate cynic, slowly becomes best friends  with his giant, the ultimate innocent. And there are actually a fair amount  of laughs along the way.It helps to know that this picture was inspired  by the late Andre the Giant, who worked with Crystal on "The Princess  Bride." Giants' lives are never easy, and that's why this picture has  to be serious as well as fun.I have the feeling this picture may play  better on video. If you like funny-sad pictures, check it out.
Title: N/A
